message.content:
cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.AI, cs.DC, cs.SE 

Reasoning: 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes a novel PMU fog system for early anomaly detection in a wide area PMU network, which involves control and monitoring of power systems. 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper discusses the challenges of real-time communication in a high-frequency, high-accuracy phasor measurement system and proposes a solution using fog computing. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper evaluates two anomaly detection approaches, Singular Spectrum Analysis (SSA) and K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), which are both machine learning techniques. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper proposes a hierarchical edge-fog-cloud computing architecture for efficient data processing and communication in a PMU network. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper discusses the implementation and evaluation of the proposed PMU fog system using simulation experiments based on Riverbed Modeler.
